programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: Four friends and die-hard anglers set out to be the first to fish the most remote waters in the world. They begin with a gruelling jungle expedition to investigate rumours of a golden dorado, a large predatory fish, following migrating baitfish up an uncharted Bolivian river

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NASCAR Champion Ryan Newman gets ATM to make a desk aquarium, and Boston Red Sox star Shane Victorino asks the brothers-in-law to build a Hawaiian themed tank

programme.desc: Robert follows in his fathers steps wrangling Utah, a highly venomous king cobra. A vet from the zoos hospital, Dr Amber, visits Tandora to care for wild koalas

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: A request for help takes a tragic turn when Tia helps a man care for two dogs he rescued. Meanwhile, a volunteer at Villalobos steps up to adopt a canine with an unusual past

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps a firefighter in Los Angeles who is struggling to deal with a crazy cat, while a Texan couple are disturbed by their kittys night-time terrors

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Two rookies from the 59th cadet class of Texas Game Wardens work their first cases. The search is on for a hunter lost in the Big Thicket Preserve in East Texas

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A golden retriever is rushed into surgery after swallowing a childs dummy, and then the team step in to save a stray dog that has been hit by a car in Oklahoma

programme.title: The Dark Side of the Sun
programme.desc: Scientists have only recently begun to understand the true nature of our ‘local star, the Sun. This program discusses its past and future, and its effect on our planet

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The Texas Game Wardens are called when a nuisance alligator gets too close for comfort, while a suburban squirrel hunter is caught trespassing

programme.title: Wild Mexico
programme.desc: A profile of the North American country, an ancient land full of diversity and mystery, and home to a vast wilderness of oceans, deserts, jungle and unique creatures

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team are faced with saving a dog that goes into cardiac arrest shortly after arriving at the clinic

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: More fly-on-the-wall action following day-to-day life in the Villalobos Rescue Centre. Tia Torres packs up her family, the parolees and her pit bulls to move the operations centre across the country to New Orleans in Louisiana

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia meets a family of eight looking to adopt a new dog after losing their previous pooch to cancer. Plus, a rescue-call takes mother and daughter into New Orleanss infamous ninth ward

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy this week comes to the aid of felines Littlez and Whiskey, whose troublesome temperaments need reining in

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy investigates the behaviour of cat Einstein, which is mild until it sees fellow feline Izzy - and then goes on the attack. Plus, an expectant couple worry about their pets mood swings

programme.title: Megalodon: The Monster Shark Lives
programme.desc: Documentary seeking evidence of the existence of a massive prehistoric shark, which would have been the largest predatory marine creature ever. The film aims to identify if such a monster might have died out 200 million years ago, and if not, whether it still stalks the uncharted depths of the ocean

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: The science behind amazing animal facts, including how a lizard can walk on water. Plus, the question of whether jellyfish live for ever

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: A bird expert reveals how a barn owl catches prey it cannot even see. Plus, what makes octopuses masters of disguise

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Wildlife biologist Forrest Gallante scours the globe using cutting-edge technology on his mission to find species that the world has stopped looking for

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.sub-title: A Sea Lion Pup Grows Up
programme.desc: The zookeepers face unexpected setbacks weaning a bright sea lion pup off her mothers milk, and are also forced to step in to support a rejected curassow chick

programme.title: Surviving Joe Exotic
programme.desc: Joe Exotic gives one of his last interviews before his arrest. Plus, ex-employees reveal the truth about his infamous zoo, and there is a look at the rescue of some of its big cats

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Alaskan family the Kilchers struggle through a record-breaking harsh winter, and Atz, Lee and Jane search for food

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine. School is in full swing and in just a few months the students will be doctors - but first they must first pass their final rotations

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Tensions are high throughout the Pennsylvania veterinary school as the day arrives when the fourth-year students find out whether they have been matched to an internship programme

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Deep in the Alaskan bush lives a family who was born and raised wild. Billy and Amy Brown and their children live off the grid and rely on each other to survive

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents an edition first broadcast September 18, 1998. Includes performances by All Saints, Aerosmith, Pulp, Alishas Attic and Honeyz

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 25 September 1998. Featuring Jennifer Paige, Lutricia McNeal, The Divine Comedy, Aerosmith, Deetah, Eels, PJ Harvey and Melanie B feat Missy Elliott

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read presents an edition first broadcast on November 1, 1979. Featuring performances by Sparks, the Ramblers, Darts, the Jam, Lene Lovich, Thin Lizzy, Suzi Quatro, BA Robertson and Lena Martell. Plus, dance sequences by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Nicky Campbell present the edition first aired on November 3 1988. Featuring performances by Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine, Robert Palmer, Tanita Tikaram, Bryan Ferry, Robin Beck, Kylie Minogue, Yazz, Enya and Guns N Roses

programme.title: Eurythmics at the BBC
programme.desc: Dave Stewart and Annie Lennoxs synthpop group were one of the biggest British acts of the 1980s, being bold, innovative, stylish and always highly unpredictable. The pair first tasted chart success in the Tourists before breaking away and achieving international stardom with songs like Love Is a Stranger and Sisters Are Doin It for Themselves, and their evolving look and sound are captured here in a collection of best moments from the BBCs music archives

programme.title: Annie Lennox at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the singer-songwriters finest performances plucked from the BBC archives, celebrating the solo side of her accomplishments, which started in earnest with the release of her hugely acclaimed debut solo album Diva in 1992. Since then she has shown time and time again exactly why she remains one of the nations most popular and critically praised artists, as is evidence in this selection of her finest performances plucked from the BBC archives

programme.title: Annie Lennox: BBC One Sessions
programme.desc: The Academy Award-winning singer performs at LSO St Lukes, London, with members of the BBC Concert Orchestra. The session includes songs from the Eurythmics back catalogue, together with material from her solo career. First shown in 2009

programme.title: Annie Lennox: Diva
programme.desc: Andrea Miller interviews the Eurythmics star, who talks about her life and her personal and musical relationship with Dave Stewart. The programme also features an extensive selection of archive footage

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents an edition first broadcast September 18, 1998. Includes performances by All Saints, Aerosmith, Pulp, Alishas Attic and Honeyz

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 25 September 1998. Featuring Jennifer Paige, Lutricia McNeal, The Divine Comedy, Aerosmith, Deetah, Eels, PJ Harvey and Melanie B feat Missy Elliott

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Nicky Campbell present the edition first aired on November 3 1988. Featuring performances by Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine, Robert Palmer, Tanita Tikaram, Bryan Ferry, Robin Beck, Kylie Minogue, Yazz, Enya and Guns N Roses

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried decides it is time the practices image moved with the times. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tragedy mars a birthday celebration, while a late-night drink leaves James and Siegfried facing the long arm of the law. Rural drama, guest starring Dorothy Tutin, with Robert Hardy and Christopher Timothy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James takes part in the annual village cricket match, where the already legendary Freddie Trueman is one of the captains, and Siegfried offers solace when a goldfish dies. Rural drama, with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Civil servants Harcourt and Pendleton back Cravens attempts to discover why Emma broke into the Northmoor nuclear plant, and before long a man he once jailed is implicated in her murder. Meanwhile, CIA agent Darius Jedburgh presses ahead with his own investigation

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Craven hacks into MI5s computer database and discovers a route into the Northmoor nuclear plant, while the President orders Jedburgh to get proof of Grogans illegal activities - by stealing his plutonium. Bob Peck and Joe Don Baker star in Troy Kennedy-Martins award-winning political thriller

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson looks back at a 1974 interview with the actor, who at the time was battling against alcoholism and had just spent six weeks in hospital for treatment. Parkinson persuaded him to talk candidly about his career, love life and drink problems

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo has a burglar alarm installed, but Tom and Barbara claim they have nothing left worth stealing. Jerry is convinced he has failed to succeed his boss as head of the firm, and the Goods decide that despite all their problems, they are glad they became self-sufficient. Seventies comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Richard Briers

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: A territorial battle develops in the corridors of power. Sir Humphrey has skilfully moved the PMs political adviser Dorothy Wainwright out of her office - but she insists on moving back. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried decides it is time the practices image moved with the times. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tragedy mars a birthday celebration, while a late-night drink leaves James and Siegfried facing the long arm of the law. Rural drama, guest starring Dorothy Tutin, with Robert Hardy and Christopher Timothy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James takes part in the annual village cricket match, where the already legendary Freddie Trueman is one of the captains, and Siegfried offers solace when a goldfish dies. Rural drama, with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers, with JJ Chalmers and Kym Marsh

programme.title: Crimewatch Caught
programme.desc: How a gang illegally digging up roads to divert electricity to power dozens of cannabis farms was caught. Plus, the shoddy builder who took £35,000 from an unwitting victim. Narrated by Rav Wilding

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell keep an eye on three property renovations in Havant in Hampshire, Sutton-in-Ashfield in Nottinghamshire and Brighton. Two of the developers start their projects thinking they might make their auction buys their homes, though it remains possible that valuations at the end of the projects will make them change their minds

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents as two family duos are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction in Heanor, Derbyshire. Mother and daughter Kate and Ellie, guided by antiques expert Irita Marriott, compete against grandmother and grandson Carole and Tom, skippered by expert John Cameron. Natasha keeps tabs on events and in the workshop of historical costumier Ninya Mikhaila, learns about the techniques used to decorate Tudor garments, including one called pinking

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a local head teacher is threatened, new boy Donal takes charge of the investigation - and Chloe worries that her secret boyfriend is the culprit. Lois spots Luke with a woman and warns Eve to take care of her marriage, leaving Eve wondering if he is having an affair. Lois has problems of her own as she faces a health scare. Elsewhere, Clint refuses to give Brandi her job back, so Nicole concocts a cunning plan. Tara Lynne ONeill stars

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple from Scotland to find a characterful cottage in the Cotswolds with a £600,000 budget. While in the region, Nicki drops in on show jumping legend and double Olympic gold medallist Nick Skelton and his sons Harry and Dan, who are following in their fathers footsteps

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Winchester, Hampshire, to transform Stefan and Lucindas unloved plot into a garden inspired by their love of making meals outdoors. The pair want to see a kitchen in the garden and a spot to grow produce that they can cook on a barbecue. All this needs to be achieved on a £6,000 budget

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Phil Wang

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: Fields of Danger as Farmer Is Impaled and Eagles Threaten Highland Flocks
programme.desc: Documentary following the police, fire and ambulance services as they attend emergency situations in rural communities. The East Anglian Air Ambulance races to save a farmer after a freak accident, lambs face attack from birds of prey, and reporter Paul Colgan investigates illegal fly-tipping in Cheshire. Featuring accounts from first responders, community members and farmers at the centre of these emergencies

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: Mackenzie Clarke gets VIP access to the chart-topping band Point Ruins reunion concert, when one of their members is murdered in the green room. But with all the suspects on stage at the time, how could the killer have done it? Away from the murder, Glenn and Daisy send out invitations to their wedding, and Mackenzie has to deal with her feelings when shes not invited

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan hosts as comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Lewis Goodall join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the weeks news

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: Finding himself back where he began, Alan is forced to wonder if he has come full circle or gone nowhere, before a tragic death leads to a moment of quite staggering catharsis. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, with Felicity Montagu and Dan Tetsell

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Hollywood star Glen Powell who is appearing in dystopian action thriller The Running Man. Also on the sofa are Oscar-winner Michelle Yeoh, who is playing Madame Morrible in Wicked: For Good, Emmy-winning Brit Rosamund Pike, currently in crime caper sequel Now You See Me: Now You Dont and comedian-actor Jack Whitehall, one of the stars of tense thriller series Malice. Plus, Ed Sheeran chats and performs Camera, from his current album Play

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul presents the Snatch game with a new twist, which sees the queens showcase their best celebrity dating and improvisation skills as they fight for the affections of broadcaster Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr are joined in the panel by comedy actress Susan Wokoma

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: Worried about her finances when her book fails to find a publisher, Patsy is given the tip that Kate Moss has left her PR company and will be looking for new representation. Things start to go awry when the plot to approach the model goes horribly wrong and Patsy and Edina find themselves vilified by the entire nation and have to flee the country. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Sam Holland, Jeremy Lee and Crystelle Pereira, as well as Celebrity Traitors star Joe Marler. Olly Smith picks the drinks to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: The Lady Mayors Show 2025
programme.desc: Katie Derham presents coverage of the civic parade in the City of London, celebrating the appointment of Susan Langley. Tina Daheley catches up with participants on the ground. Featuring an appearance by the hydroplane Bluebird K7 alongside the Pearly Kings and Queens

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Manchester City v Liverpool. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Richard Madley assist the teams in Oswestry, Shropshire, while Christina Trevanion visits the costume department at the Royal Shakespeare Company

programme.title: Live International Rugby League
programme.desc: England v Australia (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the third and final match of the Ashes series, which takes place at AMT Headingley Stadium in Leeds. This is the first meeting between the sides at this ground since 1975, when England claimed a 12-0 win, but the Kangaroos thrashed Great Britain 44-4 on their last visit to the venue in 2004

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoons news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Richie Anderson, Tasha Ghouri, JB Gill, Una Healy, Tamzin Outhwaite and Nina Wadia are paired with six contestants hoping to outwit each other to win big in the celebrity version of the quiz show, hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: The couples show off another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke, as well as the viewers, in the hope of avoiding the fate of last weeks eliminated couple Ellie and Vito. Theyll be working hard to stay as far away from the bottom of the leaderboard as possible - but as the series has proved, thats no guarantee of avoiding the dance off. Presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the quiz show with the giant spinning wheel, with Ed Gamble, Jonathan Ross, Liz Bonnin, the Rev Richard Coles, Jo Brand, Francis Bourgeois and AJ Odudu advising the contestants as they answer their way to a fortune

programme.title: Royal British Legion Festival of Remembrance 2025
programme.desc: The annual commemorative performance from the Royal Albert Hall, featuring performances from Rod Stewart, Blessing Offor, Sam Ryder, Keala Settle and the Wellermen, as well as the Central Band of the RAF, the RAF Squadronaires, the Kings Colour Squadron, and The Band of HM Royal Marines. The Festival will commemorate both the 80th anniversary of the end of the Second World War and the 25th anniversary of the UK Government lifting the ban on gay, lesbian, and bisexual personnel serving openly in the armed forces

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium and Sunderland v Arsenal at Stadium of Light. Spurs were looking for another victory over United after defeating them four times last season, including in the UEFA Europa League final. The Gunners are aiming to go one better than in each of the last three seasons and win the title, but faced a test of their credentials against the Black Cats, who had made an impressive start to the campaign. Plus, Everton v Fulham, West Ham United v Burnley and Chelsea v Wolverhampton Wanderers

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers talks to USA manager Emma Hayes, who previously guided Chelsea to seven FA Womens Super League titles

programme.title: The Mercy
programme.desc: The story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe in 1968. The struggles he confronted on the controversial voyage, while his family awaited his return, is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times. Factual drama, starring Colin Firth, David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge Shirley Ballas joins Rattus for a waltz through the history of dance, with Bruno Tonioli as Nero, who had his dance teacher killed, and Queen Victorias Highland reel

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Charles Darwin hosts a timely look at how humans have treated the planet throughout history. With Henry VIII, the inventor of the plastic bag and Judge Rinder

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: Each accompanied by a partner or family member, broadcaster Roman Kemp, actor Dylan Llewellyn, broadcaster and writer Anita Rani, actress and singer Molly Rainford embark on an epic 5,900km race through the entirety of Central America. The race begins on Isla Mujeres, the easternmost point of Mexico and a sacred island of the Maya. The four pairs must pass through five checkpoints to reach the finish line in Península de la Guajira, the northernmost region of South America

programme.title: The Man Who Murdered His Family
programme.desc: The story of the life and downfall of Grant Amato, whose obsession with an internet cam model led to betrayal, financial ruin and murder. He enjoyed a life of success and privilege before his infactuation took grip

programme.title: The Man Who Murdered His Family
programme.desc: Grant Amato is on trial for his life, and the evidence is piling up against him while the media focuses on cam model Silvie as the key to the case

programme.title: The Man Who Murdered His Family
programme.desc: Grant Amato becomes famous after his case goes viral. Film director Colin Archdeacon travels to Bulgaria in the hope of finding the one person who may hold the answers to this mystery. After years of claiming his innocence, Amato reveals stunning new information about the murders that sends police on a mad dash to uncover the truth

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Tire retraces Sarms last known movements and tracks down two boat captains whose vessels were moored near the yacht she vanished from. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarms last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from, and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: How the crew of Doctor Who re-created 19th-century France in the Croatian town of Trojir, where The Vampires of Venice was also filmed. Plus, actor Tony Curran explores the work of Vincent Van Gogh at the J Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles, which houses one of his most valuable paintings. Narrated by Alex Price

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord and Amy travel to 19th-century Provence, where they join forces with Vincent Van Gogh to battle an invisible alien only the artist can see. As well as combating the terrors that lurk in the cornfields, they try to restore the tormented painters happiness. Written by Richard Curtis (Love Actually) and guest starring Tony Curran (This Life) and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an Essex wife - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma bumps into an old flame and realises she still has feelings for him. She introduces him to Malcolm, who tries to impress him. Malcolm tries to retrieve his belongings that Davina had left in the loft when she sold the old family home, but the new owners refuse to let him in. Derek hatches a plan for Malcolm to break into the house and retrieve his stuff. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Sherrie Hewson

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm and Derek throw Gemma a baby shower. Derek surprises Malcolm with an escape room for his birthday, where they are kidnapped off the street. However, the duo later get locked within it. Xander discovers Gemma in labour and unable to contact Malcolm, and with no one else available to be her birthing partner, Xander has to step in. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood and David Morrissey

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul presents the Snatch game with a new twist, which sees the queens showcase their best celebrity dating and improvisation skills as they fight for the affections of broadcaster Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr are joined in the panel by comedy actress Susan Wokoma

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Alexandra Palace in north London, venue of the BBCs first ever television broadcast, stages the south of England heat, as comics Blank Peng, Fab Goualin, Sharifa Butterfly, Sydney May and Evaldas Karosas battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown. Host Sara Pascoe is joined by stand-up comics Catherine Bohart and Michael Odewale, who appear alongside Fatiha El-Ghorri on the panel of judges

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise meets her dad for the first time, but he shows more interest in Jonny than in her. Donna gives Gaz an answer to his marriage proposal and Janet comes up with a new way of supporting her child - which is not strictly legal

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: After being chatted up by Louises father, Jonny resolves to become more macho but things dont go as planned. Donna refuses to have a baby with Gaz, leaving him with only one option for getting the child he so desperately wants

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Donna regrets persuading Gaz to try tantric sex when he gets hooked on it, while Louise wants a new family and seems to know exactly where to find one. Jonny gets a job as a farmer and Janet increases her home security

programme.title: Ranger Hamzas Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how butterflies and moths play an important role in the environment. They find out that they are fantastic pollinators who help to create habitats for other creatures to live. They learn how their poo can return nutrients to the soil and how butterflies and moths can be food for other animals too. On the way, they get up close to a dragonfly and turn into Rambler butterflies!

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar give Winnie the white rhino a mud bath. They find out how the mud keeps rhinos skin nice and healthy. Their next encounter is with hissing cockroaches, which they get to hold so that they can get a closer look at this very unique animal. Steve and Aneeshwar then reveal the special connection that these two animals share in the wild.

programme.desc: Ria Chatterjee meets the ordinary people fighting deportation amid President Trumps immigration crackdown, as federal agents target undocumented migrants across Los Angeles. LA is a self-declared sanctuary city and supposedly a safe haven for migrants, but across the country, US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is targeting 11 million undocumented migrants and is tasked to make 3,000 arrests a day, the impact of which is being felt up and down Los Angeles - where nearly half the residents are Latino

In this episode, a young couple challenge themselves to fit a camper on the back of a tiny Italian Tuk-Tuk, and a father of two boys creates a quirky getaway in an abandoned nuclear bunker. Meanwhile, George and Will Hardie create lightweight furniture for their sky cabin, with mixed results

Steph and Christopher have been outbid 10 times even though theyve bid as much as £50,000 over asking price

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer step into the middle of a domestic deadlock in Wolverhampton. Gordon, Suky and their three children live in a four-bedroom home that they bought in 2011, lured by the promise of an indoor pool - but while that feature may still be making a splash, the rest of the house is sinking fast. Suky is desperate to escape as she loathes the gloomy interiors, the severe lack of storage and the claustrophobic, isolating kitchen. On the other hand, Gordon is firmly anchored, convinced that with a little help from Kirstie, their house could become the perfect family home

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

She also examines the impact of the Knights of St John, a military monastic order that transformed Rhodes into a medieval stronghold, attends a traditional carnival, and visits the oldest in Greece

programme.title: Titanic: Secrets of the Shipwreck

This time, fellow comedian Sarah Millican joins him for an exploration of the Lithuanian capital Vilnius. The duo take to the skies to see the city from above - an experience they find by turns terrifying, thrilling and beautiful. Keen to explore Lithuanian cuisine, they sample cold beetroot soup and cepelini dumplings washed down with gira, a drink made from fermented beer. Later, the pair explore Vilnius medieval centre on foot, taking in Gediminass tower and Lukiskes Prison

programme.title: The Big Snow of 47
programme.desc: Houses buried under snow, rivers frozen solid, bombers called upon to drop bread to isolated villages. How did Brits survive the snowiest winter ever recorded? Less than two years after the Second World War ended, with food strictly rationed and most homes without central heating, the nation shivered for seven long weeks in a Siberian climate. Huge snow drifts and plunging temperatures of -21C caused frozen railways, factory shutdowns, power cuts and a farming crisis. Famous faces including John Craven, Amanda Barrie, Timothy West and Neil Kinnock share childhood memories of the extreme winter and explain why it remains unparalleled

programme.title: The Jobless Prince: What Will Harry Do Next?
programme.desc: A team of experts featuring PR specialists, businesspeople, life coaches and royal insiders looks at what the future holds for the Duke of Sussex, with his ties to the royal family being strained and his public image polarising opinion. They explore what his real passions and skills are, and examine whether he can learn from the examples of other members of the royal family and whose playbook should he avoid following

programme.title: Meghan and Harry: Where Did the Money Go?
programme.desc: For nearly a decade, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have captured the worlds attention like no other couple, relentlessly splashed across tabloid covers. But beyond the glitz and glamour, questions swirl around their finances and how they make their money remains a deep mystery. This programme looks at how they have maintained their lavish lifestyle after leaving the royal familys purse strings behind

programme.title: When TV Goes Horribly Wrong

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Monica and Chandlers Wedding - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The gang continues to search for the missing Chandler, who is still suffering a severe case of premarital jitters. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel tries to decide what to do next, while Phoebe takes some of the heat off her by claiming she is the one who is pregnant. programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Red Sweater
programme.desc: Joey becomes convinced Phoebe is pregnant and proposes to her so she will not have to be a single mother - but Monica quickly tells him the truth. Meanwhile, Chandler and Ross misplace the disposable cameras used during the wedding

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel reveals the identity of the father of her baby, while Chandler and Monica go on their honeymoon, but are constantly upstaged by another couple who get preferential treatment wherever they go

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Rachels attempt to explain how they ended up in bed together descends into an argument about who made the first move - until Ross shocks everyone by announcing he captured the whole encounter on videotape. David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston star

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is horrified to learn Rachel is going on a date with a handsome soap star, and Chandler sabotages a quirky workmates chances of promotion. Meanwhile, Phoebe is attracted to a cute but clumsy chef whom Monica plans to fire. Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox star

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Halloween Party
programme.desc: Phoebe finds herself attracted to flighty twin sister Ursulas fiance as the gang has fun at Monicas Halloween party. The Bings dress up as Catwoman and a pink bunny, and Rachel tries to kick-start her maternal instincts with a host of trick-or-treaters. Guest starring Sean Penn

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Pregnant Rachel considers moving out, prompting Ross to tell her about a vacancy in his building, and Joey creates a nursery to persuade her to stay. Eric dumps Ursula for twin sister Phoebe, and Monica suspects her new maid could be stealing her jeans - among other things. Guest starring Sean Penn

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel finally tells her father she is pregnant, prompting him to confront Ross - who is just snuggling up to new girlfriend Mona. Monica feels guilty about denying Chandler a stripper on his stag night so she books one to make amends - but he gets a lot more than he bargained for

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The gang celebrates Thanksgiving and Monica invites old high-school friend Will, the only student who was fatter than her - unaware of his animosity toward Rachel. Meanwhile, Chandler and Phoebe try to avoid helping in the kitchen and Joey vows to eat an entire turkey. Guest starring Brad Pitt

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe discovers Ben goes to school with Stings son and immediately sets about trying to wangle free concert tickets. programme.sub-title: The One with the Creepy Holiday Card
programme.desc: Rachels hormones act up, prompting her to proposition Joey, and Chandlers newly divorced boss takes him to a strip club, convinced he and Monica are having problems. Meanwhile, Ross is disturbed to learn girlfriend Mona wants them to send out joint Christmas cards like a married couple

programme.title: Friends

Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding host, alongside judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: A secret agent branded a traitor tries to clear his name, with the aid of a socially awkward inventor he had fired for only developing non-lethal gadgets. The scientists latest invention gets out of control and transforms the spy into a pigeon - giving him the perfect disguise to prove his innocence. Animated adventure, with the voices of Will Smith, Tom Holland and Karen Gillan

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: You Kent Always Say What You Want
programme.desc: Homer accidentally causes the sacking of newsreader Kent Brockman - who moves in with the family and sets about trying to win his job back by conducting a high-profile campaign against unethical media practices. With the voice of rapper Ludacris

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart and Lisa are thrilled when their parents send them to Kamp Krusty for the summer - but when they arrive, they discover that having fun will not be high on the agenda. Animated antics, with the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge astonishes Homer and the kids by landing the role of Blanche DuBois in an amateur production of A Streetcar Named Desire - and her performance is boosted by her frustration with Homer. With the guest voice of Jon Lovitz

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer decides to skip church so he can enjoy himself watching TV, making waffles and dancing semi-naked in the guise of Tom Cruise. When he subsequently experiences a vision from God, the lazy father is inspired to start his own religion. Animated comedy, with the voice of Dan Castellaneta

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer enters Lisa in a beauty pageant to boost her self-esteem, and has the satisfaction of seeing her crowned runner-up - but she finds her principles heavily compromised as a result. Featuring the voice of Bob Hope

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics review the best Christmas programming of 2024, including the Strictly Christmas Special, Gavin and Stacey: The Finale, First Dates at Christmas, Hot Frosty, Bullseye, The Good Ship Murder Christmas Special, Martin Lewis: How to Win at Board Games, The Dog House at Christmas, Is It Cake? Holiday and Fanny Cradock Cooks for Christmas

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on recent shows, including The 1% Club, Is It Cake?, Casualty, The Completely Made-Up Adventures of Dick Turpin, The Yorkshire Farm and This Morning. They also reflect on BBC News coverage of the rising cost of living

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics settle back to share their opinions on TV highlights, including Race Across the World, The Apprentice, Ripley, MasterChef, Hunted, Celebrity Bridge of Lies and The Assembly. From April 2024

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, shes looking for a man to become her plus-one in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dapper 24-year-old Will is looking for a woman to share his love of the countryside, but he has never had a girlfriend and is not a natural when it comes to chatting up a lady, while lofty long-haired rocker Daniel, aka Squid, strides into the restaurant on a mission to break the rules. Mum-of-two Emma, 47, is all glammed up and ready to play the love lottery, but Cupid throws a huge surprise her way, and when the man who broke her heart walks through the door the drama begins

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: After learning Dave and Gemma occasionally see a couples therapist to keep their marriage strong, Tina decides she and Calvin should do the same, much to Calvins consternation

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys science skills are put to the test when they get a flat tyre during Leonards surprise bachelor party weekend in Mexico. Meanwhile, the girls finally force Penny to break the news to her family that she has eloped with Leonard. Keith Carradine guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny and Leonard announce that they are moving in together, prompting Sheldon to revisit 2003, a much simpler time before he had met either of them. Howard and Raj form a band to play at the comic-book store, only to fall out over musical differences

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The boys want to become more sporty, so Barry Kripke leads them in a fencing lesson, while Penny, Amy and Bernadette help Stuart, who wants to attract more female customers to the comic-book store

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jeans Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chefs attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentists waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Theres a serious crash in the fog and the team battle to free a trucker trapped in his cab by metal. A bizarre accident in a soft play centre leads to a suspected spinal injury

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A biker without a helmet crashes, and the team launch a desperate fight to save his life as his horrified family look on. A man with a gun barricades himself into a canal boat

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A Lamborghini supercar crashes and bursts into flames leaving two passengers with serious injuries. Also, a patient requiring urgent care leaves the team with an outsized problem

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A car being pursued by police crashes and HART are called to treat a passenger trapped in her seat with serious injuries. Meanwhile, floodwaters swamp a Yorkshire town.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates this series exploring extreme behaviour in the natural world, uncovering some of the strategies animals have developed to stay alive and to breed, from Komodo dragons tackling buffalo to the courtship battle of the humpback whale. He begins by focusing on the methods used by creatures such as cheetahs, bottle-nosed dolphins and Venus fly-traps in their fights for survival

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how reptiles and amphibians, including the pebble toad and Jesus Christ lizard, conquer their shortcomings by using tricks and strategies to avoid predators. He also explores how chameleons can achieve a high level of accuracy with their muscle-propelled, extendible tongues, and finds out how a 9ft-long Komodo dragon can bring down a huge water buffalo

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how mammals dominate the planet and survive in extreme habitats. In the Antarctic, a lone Weddell seal wears its teeth down keeping an ice hole open to catch fish for its pup. In warmer climes, the gerbil-like rufous sengi demonstrates impressive speed to avoid reptilian predators, giant bats feast on fruit trees in Zambia and male humpback whales battle for a female

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to fish, the most diverse vertebrates on the planet, made up of more than 28,000 species. Off the coast of South Australia, sea dragons pair up for courtship, engaging in a mirror dance before the eggs are laid on the males tail. Gobies climb up the vertical rocks of Hawaiian waterfalls to access secluded pools at the summit, and flying fish use their elongated pectoral fins to escape from predators. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker settles into his new job as Minister for Administrative Affairs, ably assisted - and hindered - by civil servants Bernard Woolley and Sir Humphrey Appleby. First episode of the comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: The visiting head of an African nation turns out to be an old college pal of Hacker - who promptly sets about trying to offload some British-made oil-rigging gear. Satirical comedy set in the world of Westminster, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Cutbacks to the civil service threaten the permanent secretarys position so Sir Humphrey tries to manipulate Hacker into abandoning his new policy. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker is challenged to convince Sir Humphrey that a computer holding vital citizen information could raise concerns about peoples rights to privacy. Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne star

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hackers latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington. First broadcast in 1980

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker believes he needs to know everything going on in his department, and is furious to learn Sir Humphrey is withholding information. However, when events take a surprising turn, he starts to understand why sometimes it is better to keep a minister in the dark

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools is joined by Shara Nelson, Aztec Camera, Jellyfish and Leonard Cohen.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. His estranged wife also turns up wanting to take the boy away, but he is forced to put duty before his family when called on to rescue children kidnapped by Apaches on the Mexican border. John Fords Western, with John Wayne, Maureen OHara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: US Navy officers rebel against their ships erratic captain during a violent storm at sea, only to face a court martial back on dry land. However, the crews actions seem to have been justified when evidence questioning the mental stability of their superior is produced. Second World War drama based on Herman Wouks novel, starring Humphrey Bogart, Jose Ferrer, Fred MacMurray and Van Johnson

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: A beautiful woman arouses the ardour of three rival suitors in 19th-century rural Dorset and, having flirted and toyed with their affections, she chooses to marry a caddish, gambling soldier - a decision that leads to a sequence of harrowing events. John Schlesingers adaptation of Thomas Hardys classic novel, with Julie Christie, Alan Bates, Terence Stamp and Peter Finch

programme.title: Jerry and Marge Go Large
programme.desc: A couple discover a mathematical loophole in the Massachusetts lottery and win millions to revive and rejuvenate their small town. Comedy drama based on a true story, starring Bryan Cranston, Annette Bening, Rainn Wilson and Larry Wilmore

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: In 1719 on the Northern Great Plains, Comanche tracker Naru undertakes a rite of passage to slay a ferocious predator. During a fierce tussle with a mountain lion, Naru glimpses strange lights in the treeline: a warning that a highly evolved, otherworldly creature with cloaking technology and explosive armaments is at large on the plains. Sci-fi thriller, starring Amber Midthunder and Dakota Beavers. Directed by Dan Trachtenberg, who also helmed recent franchise offerings Predator: Killer of Killers, and Predator: Badlands

programme.title: Attack the Block
programme.desc: A student nurse living in a south London tower block escapes a dangerous encounter with a teenage gang when aliens invade. As the creatures cause mayhem throughout the estate, she joins forces with her would-be attackers to fight off the extraterrestrial forces. Sci-fi comedy thriller, with Jodie Whittaker, John Boyega and Nick Frost

programme.title: Save Yourselves!
programme.desc: A young Brooklyn couple head to a remote upstate cabin to unplug from their phones and reconnect with each other. Blissfully unaware of their surroundings, they are left to their own devices as the planet falls under attack. Sci-fi comedy, starring Sunita Mani, John Reynolds and Ben Sinclair

programme.title: Lola
programme.desc: In 1940, two friends build a machine that can intercept radio and television broadcasts from the future. Co-writer/director Andrew Legges sci-fi drama, starring Emma Appleton and Stefanie Martini

programme.title: The Kid Who Would Be King
programme.desc: Alex is a 12-year-old lad who is starting a new term at school and trying to adapt to his new surroundings. While hiding from bullies in a construction site, he finds a mysterious sword and discovers its King Arthurs Excalibur. Eventually Alex meets legendary wizard Merlin and faces up to a tense battle with the evil Morgana. Joe Cornishs fantasy action adventure, starring Louis Ashbourne Serkis, Rebecca Ferguson and Tom Taylor.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: An alien who crash-lands on Earth falls in love with a widow after assuming her dead husbands identity as a cover, but the duo are soon fleeing the authorities in a frantic effort to reach an extraterrestrial rescue ship. Sci-fi fantasy romance, directed by John Carpenter and starring Jeff Bridges, Karen Allen, Charles Martin Smith, Richard Jaeckel and Robert Phalen

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: A woman raises her six-year-old daughter to believe that Santa Claus does not exist, but they both have a change of heart after meeting a department store Father Christmas who claims to be the man himself. When the kindly fellow is accused of being a charlatan, his new friends engage a lawyer to prove his true identity. Remake of the 1947 family drama, with Richard Attenborough, Elizabeth Perkins, Mara Wilson and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Le Mans 66
programme.desc: Racing car driver and engineer Carroll Shelby is lured out of retirement during the 1960s, in a period where the sport is dominated by Italian companies. Ford Motors are hoping to revive their flagging fortunes by launching a racing division and securing a high-profile win at the prestigious Le Mans 24-hour race. Shelby takes up the challenge of headlining the plan to build a revolutionary new race car, but courts conflict within the company by recruiting unpredictable, short-tempered British driver Ken Miles to take the wheel. Fact-based drama, starring Matt Damon, Christian Bale, Jon Bernthal and Caitriona Balfe

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: Former Special Forces operative Roy Pulver wakes every day in his apartment with a beautiful woman in his bed and assassins trying to kill him. Stuck in a time loop, Roy must dodge bullets and blade attacks to unlock the mystery behind his repetitive and untimely demise. Action comedy, starring Frank Grillo

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: An Irishman in 19th-century New York is taken under the wing of the ruthless gang leader who killed his father 15 years before, and rises up the ranks of power - all the while plotting his revenge. Meanwhile, the tension caused by the enforced drafting of the population into the army to fight in the Civil War explodes into bloodshed and riots. Martin Scorseses epic historical drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis, Cameron Diaz and Liam Neeson

programme.title: Straightheads
programme.desc: A woman and her lover are attacked by a gang while driving down a remote country road, an experience that leaves them traumatised. Later returning to the area in the wake of her fathers death, she encounters one of her attackers by chance and sees the opportunity to take revenge. Thriller, starring Gillian Anderson and Danny Dyer

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: An ageing secret service agent, tormented by his failure to save the life of John F Kennedy in 1963, is drawn into a battle of wits with a sinister CIA-trained assassin out to kill the current president. As the day of reckoning draws closer, the agents nerves are tested to the limit - and nothing seems to be going his way. Wolfgang Petersens thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo and Dylan McDermott

Thriller sequel, with Michael Caine reprising his role from The Ipcress File alongside Jason Connery, Mia Sara, Michael Gambon and Sue Lloyd

programme.title: Heartbeat

Vernon and David branch out into a new line of business, and soon manage to pep up a few palates with Aunt Beths tangy horseradish sauce

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: While Britain feels the winds of change swept in by a new Labour government in 1924, Downtons residents - both above and below stairs - are undergoing alterations too. After mourning the death of his beloved wife Lady Sybil for four years, Branson decides its time he got on with his life, although Robert isnt comfortable about the ex-chauffeurs relationship with local teacher Sarah Bunting. Mary is also ready for love again - but which of her beaus is her Mr Right? Meanwhile, Edith struggles to cope with being parted from her baby, Jimmy receives unwanted female attention and plans for a war memorial cause tension

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor has his second GMC assessment - mock surgery - and Buddy is missing. Meanwhile, Kens arrival does not bring good news for Al and Bert, and Penhale unhappy with the arrival of his predecessor, Mark Mylow, who tries to take charge of his investigation. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy thinks hes pulled off quite a coup when he spies a dangerous armed robber, but the villain makes his escape and embarks on a desperate hunt for a fast car to steal. Meanwhile, Mertons singer-songwriter cousin arrives, looking for the peace and quiet she needs to work, but her pregnant daughter soon puts paid to that idea. Lulu guest stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local landowner Les Parnaby loses patience with ramblers wandering across his land and resolves to take matters into his own hands - regardless of the cost. Meanwhile, Ventresss car accident has a strange effect on Vernon Scripps, much to the delight of his many creditors. Rural police drama, starring Lloyd McGuire, Geoffrey Hughes and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. The victim was a leading light in the village - an amateur astronomer who was passionate about preserving Moonstone Ridge, a Bronze Age heritage site housing a 1930s observatory. Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. Murder mystery, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Kenny Ireland, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The year 1956 finds jazz-loving clergyman Sidney Chambers attending a talk by Reverend Nathaniel Todd, a member of the formative US civil rights movement. During the event, protestors disrupt the speech and release fireworks, causing the audience to panic. In the chaos, Todds son Charles is stabbed and killed by an unseen assailant. The murder sees racial tensions spike and Geordie Keating is called in to investigate. Things are further complicated when Sidney finds himself drawn to passionate young activist, and their tentative romance faces pressure from all sides. Robson Green stars, with James Norton, Tessa Peake-Jones, Samuel West and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Violet gone, Sidney loses himself in drink. After a heavy whiskey session leaves him without his jacket - and little memory of the night before - he discovers to his horror that he was the last person to see a young woman alive. As he struggles to remember her final words, Geordie grows concerned - both for the murdered girl, so callously abandoned outside a local slum, and for his friends troubled state of mind. James Norton stars, with Robson Green, Tessa Peake-Jones, Al Weaver and Kacey Ainsworth

programme.title: Cracker

programme.title: Cracker

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr set about renovating the bathrooms. Amanda is unconvinced about Alans bidet and Alan tries to veto Amandas disco ball installation - but neither will back down on their vision. In Alans quest to stay true to Sicilian culture, he treats Amanda to a visit to Marsalas salt pans for a unique spa experience. Amandas dreams of a roll-top bath come crashing down as Alan sets her the task of recycling the apartments existing one, but karma kicks in as his DIY skills are pushed to the limit with a masterclass in floor tiling

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Finals week begins with the five remaining hopefuls creating a dish inspired by a public figure or a piece of art, film, song, TV series or book. This is followed by a trip to the Ballymaloe House and Cookery School in Co Cork, where they learn the food philosophy of the late chef Myrtle Allen, before using everything they have picked up to prepare a celebratory dinner for some of Irelands finest food producers, historians and relatives of Myrtle

programme.title: RTÉ News: One OClock and Weather
programme.desc: National and international news

programme.title: Irelands Fittest Family
programme.desc: The search for the countrys strongest and fittest family continues. Three new coaches are joining the fold - Paralympic swimming champion Ellen Keane, Gaelic footballer Michael Darragh MacAuley, and Irish rugby legend Andrew Trimble. The McClement family from Down, the Carr family from Westmeath, the Walsh family from Cork and the Byrne family from Dublin battle it out in the first round

programme.title: Heat My Home
programme.desc: Kieran McCarthy visits a Victorian era townhouse that is having a complete retrofit. Couple Myles Kenny and Ashley Cortez run into some issues as the age of the property throws up unique challenges. Also, Kieran goes to visit a gym that is taking energy saving to an industrial scale

programme.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
programme.desc: A girl grows up in 16th-century Europe under the iron fist of her stepmother, until the love of handsome Prince Henry offers a glimmer of hope. Unfortunately, the royal gent has worries of his own in the shape of an arranged marriage. Luckily, Renaissance genius Leonardo da Vinci is on hand to play fairy godfather and bring the pair together. Romantic drama, starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston, Dougray Scott and Timothy West

programme.title: Build Your Own Home
programme.desc: The story of 30-year-old Cian Murtagh, who was homeless on the streets on Cork, until Maeve OBrien and a community group helped Cian turn his fortunes around with the launch of a GoFundMe page. The Meath man bought a derelict cottage in rural Sligo, which needed major renovation. He begins in Co Derry on the windswept shores of Loch Foyle, where the largest accumulation of coastal sands in Ireland has formed a system of dunes visible from space. He also learns how scientists are monitoring the site and hears how their work has been picked up by fellow scientists in the United States to help research the surface of Mars

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys

At the medieval Carrickfergus Castle, Michael learns of the towns important role in the history of Ireland, when William of Orange landed at its harbour and went on to fight the Battle of the Boyne, which is commemorated by Unionists to this day
